TopicTitle: What is that thing under the mountain?

Articles.Content: Make your conclusions, I was just coming back from another mission and I landed on a mountain... Suddenly I kinda look under it and see something like a ball or maybe a stone. Can it be an easter egg? Idk, it looks weird but it might be just a random rock.
Do you have Terrain scatter turned on? Like, visible stones and trees on the ground?

Do you have Terrain scatter turned on? Like, visible stones and trees on the ground?

Nope, not a single one... If its a mod, I haven't installed... Its just there, I wish I had noclip...

It is the tomb of Jeb's ancestor, Arthur Kerndragon. He's not dead; he's sleeping beneath the mountain until Kerbalkind has need of him again.

Edited September 10, 2015 by AbacusWizard
Kraken egg?
it's a ship part thats fallen through the mountain and landed on the water sphere. Kerbal is actually 2 planets layered on each other 1 is all the ground the other all the water

You may check it with a submarine

Things that sink:

- all MK3 tanks (when full)

- all Kerbodyne tanks (when full)

- MK3 to 2.5m adapters (poorly, quite buoyant)

- Twin Boar (total anchor when full!)

If you want to float back up, burn most of the fuel - all of them float when empty.
Is it marked as a piece of debris or anything? If it's not then that rules those theories out.
Give your lat/long (with a few decimal places please ) and someone else can check it out too.

Is it marked as a piece of debris or anything? If it's not then that rules those theories out.

It aint debris, the last debris from the ship that fell into Kerbin, blew up even before reaching the ground... I guess that will remain as a mistery...
If it's the object top left, it looks like a mk2 Lander Can with a heatshield both on the top and bottom.
Looks like a Rock. I tried to zoom in. And It looks kinda light brownish. It must be a rock. If you don't have terrain scatter on then I have no idea. Thats my wacky-maybe-true theory.
very mysterious:huh:.....go check it out!
Is that... Gilly?

It is the tomb of Jeb's ancestor, Arthur Kerman. He's not dead; he's sleeping beneath the mountain until Kerbalkind has need of him again.

You mean Kerbarossa?

You mean Kerbarossa?

Kagnarok...
Or Holger Kerske, perhaps, or Sir Francis Kerb.
A very ancient space Cheeto.
I can't see it. Can someone put a circle around it? I can only see the Lander Can and the normal Surface, but the camera looking trough the surface.

I can't see it. Can someone put a circle around it? I can only see the Lander Can and the normal Surface, but the camera looking trough the surface.

It's in the water. There is a huge expanse of water and roughly in the middle of it (vertically. It's about 2/3 of the way across left->right), a 5-10 pixel wide... something. I'm guessing it's a boulder.

Turning ground scatter off does not eliminate all ground scatter, just most of it. That's my guess. And until we get an exact lat/long to look ourselves, that's the best I can do.
Thanks. It is not realy easy to see it on a tablet.

Deep beneath the mountains, the magic boulder sleeps.......

(But yeah, it's almost certainly just a rock in the wrong place)
Omg, have we found the Magic Boulder again? Jeez!
